intro: Dipteracanthus haenkei, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while the fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds.
